properties.areaDesc: Elbert, GA; Pickens, SC; Franklin, GA; Oconee, SC; Hart, GA; Anderson, SC
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 13 at 7:52AM EST until February 13 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Eastern Franklin County in northeastern Georgia...
Northwestern Elbert County in northeastern Georgia...
Hart County in northeastern Georgia...
Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina...
Southeastern Pickens County in Upstate South Carolina...
Southeastern Oconee County in Upstate South Carolina...

* Until 830 AM EST.

* At 751 AM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 9 miles south of Clemson to 11 miles southwest of
Hartwell, moving east at 45 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines.

* Locations impacted include...
Anderson, Clemson, Hartwell, Homeland Park, Powdersville, Piedmont,
Belton, Central, Williamston and Northlake.
properties.instruction:
Conditions are favorable for the development of brief, weak
tornadoes. Seek shelter inside an interior room.

Lake Hartwell is in the path of these storms. Get away from the
water and seek shelter in an interior room in the nearest shelter.
If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by
lightning.

Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National
Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800,
2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using
hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the
specific location where it occurred.
